Package com.joseph.rule

Class Rule<T,R extends Rule<T,R>>

java.lang.Object
com.joseph.rule.Rule<T,R>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of the value to validate
R - Type of the rule
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateRule, NumberRule, ObjectRule, StringRule
public abstract class Rule<T,R extends Rule<T,R>> extends Object
Rule is a base class for all rules.

      protected void addConstraint(Predicate<T> predicate, String message)
      Internal helper to register a new validation requirement.
      Parameters:
      predicate - The condition to test (returns true if invalid)
      message - The error message if the predicate is true

    • check

      public R check(Consumer<T> nestedValidator)
      Allows nesting validation logic. If the nested validator throws a RecordValidationException, the errors are caught and flattened into the parent's violation list.
      Parameters:
      nestedValidator - Nested validator
      Returns:
      the current rule

    • self

      protected R self()
      Returns the current rule.
      Returns:
      the current rule

    • getFieldName

      public String getFieldName()
      Get the field name.
      Returns:
      Field name

    • getViolations

      public List<String> getViolations()
      Triggers the evaluation of all registered constraints against the current value. This method implements lazy evaluation, ensuring rules are only tested when the results are explicitly requested.
      Returns:
      A list of all validation violation messages

    • required

      public R required()
      Validates that the value is not null.
      Returns:
      the current rule

    • satisfies

      public R satisfies(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Validates that the value satisfies the given predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - Predicate to validate
      Returns:
      the current rule

    • satisfies

      public R satisfies(Predicate<T> predicate, String message)
      Validates that the value satisfies the given predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - Predicate to validate
      message - Message to display if the predicate is not satisfied
      Returns:
      the current rule

    • message

      public R message(String customMessage)
      Modifies the error message of the most recently added constraint. This allows for descriptive custom messages in fluent chains.
      Parameters:
      customMessage - The new error message to assign to the last rule
      Returns:
      the current rule for chaining
